channel.title: 3D castle for a mod
channel.description:
Im working on a 3D environment in 3D modeling package called Lightwave, in going to be updating this around every week with new renders when I get more into the model, so far i've just completed the gate with grill, now im working on the walls;
The finished model will have a moat going fully around the castle, then some height maps (Mountains n stuff) so it doesn't look like a flat terrain!!
- You might see this in a mod im creating with some friends :)
Gate + start of walls (This will be updated in about 3 hours, im posting from my aunts!)
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll245/mjownzu_07/gatewall_v1.png[/img]
V2!
[IMG]http://i290.photobucket.com/albums/ll245/mjownzu_07/v2.png[/img]
So far I don't have any renders, Ill do a full render once i've done some normal maps and heightmaps :) So far i'm on 1.5k polys (Quads+Tri's)

item.title: 3D castle for a mod
item.dc:creator: @johno2 johno2
item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

[quote=“Unhandled, post:9, topic:344366”][quote author=johno2 link=topic=440750.msg3239659#msg3239659 date=1276813001]
Suppose what you guys are saying… Less poly count the better!
[/quote]
Absolutely. Also I would assume having good topology (regardless of polycount) makes it much easier to UV map while texturing.[/quote]

Suppose your right… God, I hate texturing with Lightwave

Read full topic

item.title: 3D castle for a mod
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

johno2:

Aah, thanks man ill redo it, suppose my… topology? Was out, but in-game your never going to see the wireframe anyway, but I did change those other 2 tris.

You won’t see the wireframe, but every damn triangle counts in terms of rendering efficiency.

Read full topic

item.title: 3D castle for a mod
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“johno2, post:4, topic:344366”][quote author=thunderflea link=topic=440750.msg3239197#msg3239197 date=1276748689]
the entrance looks weird, the gate entrance area, right above it, its not symmetrical.
[/quote]

It’s just cuz of the wireframe, If I changed the camera view to flat shade it would look symmetrical :)[/quote]

No, your topology really isn’t symmetrical.
From the left side, there are 6 edges coming to the top of the gate making 6 triangles.
From the right side, there are 5 edges coming to the top of the gate making 5 triangles.
1 triangle in the middle.
Also, you have too many edges on both sides overall.

Look:

In a perfect world, you only want 4 edges coming from 1 vertice. With that drawing, you minimize triangles and vertices with more than 4 edges connecting.

Read full topic

item.title: 3D castle for a mod

item.description:
@johno2 wrote:

thunderflea:

the entrance looks weird, the gate entrance area, right above it, its not symmetrical.

It’s just cuz of the wireframe, If I changed the camera view to flat shade it would look symmetrical
